docs.lead_paragraph: ASIA INDIA: POLLS PUT HINDUS AHEAD An exit poll for the private Star TV said the Hindu nationalist-led coalition is heading for a sweeping victory in national elections that conclude Oct. 3. Another exit poll, broadcast by the state television network, put the coalition firmly in the lead, though not by such a large margin. A third, smaller exit poll, by a regional newspaper in the state of Maharashtra, showed the coalition narrowly ahead. Celia W. Dugger (NYT)
